Html:
I have a Chart with a Column Series. The data ranges from -100 to -60 (for example), but I want the vertical LinearAxis to have the range from 0 to -100 (or slightly more). I can set the Maximum and Minimum properties of the LinearAxis manually, but then then the Chart will 'Clip' if the data range exceeds the manually set limit.

Any ideas? Ideally I want to set the LinearAxis.Minimum value to "*" (or something like that) to indicate that it should stretch to the full range of the data, while LinearAxis.Maximum is set to 0.

Thank you in advance for any help on this matter.

Oh dear - I just tried playing around some more and seem to have solved the problem. I just needed to not set a value for the LinearAxis.Minimum - therefore it was autoscaling to the data. I still might run into a problem if I have data that ranges from -100 to +100 (positive and negative data) since I have set the LinearAxis.Maximum to 0 (to force showing 0 on the axis if the data is only negative).
